title: Help: Channel 4 drama examines 'undervalued' care workers during pandemic
description: A new Channel 4 film starring Jodie Comer and Stephen Graham is set in the early days of the pandemic.

title: Champions League drama as Liverpool win, Man City hit six and Messi disappoints
description: After an opening night that failed to ignite, the Champions League signals its return with drama across Europe on Wednesday.

title: Mangrove forests: Photography winners show beauty of ecosystems
description: The Mangrove Photography Award winners show unique ecosystems above and below the waterline.

title: Ros Atkins on... why people are using a horse drug
description: Ivermectin is being used by some to treat Covid-19, despite the benefits being unproven.

title: On the trail of fake medicine smugglers in Benin
description: Since the beginning of the pandemic, there’s been an increase in counterfeit drugs around the world.

title: Canadian prairie ranchers struggle with drought conditions
description: Amid a severe drought in the Prairies, some ranchers are trying to find ways to work with nature.

title: Five ways we think office work will change
description: How people think the coronavirus pandemic has affected the future of office work in five charts.

title: Alex Murdaugh: The hot shot US lawyer and the hit man
description: Months after his wife and son were found dead, police say a lawyer arranged a hit - on himself.

title: Deathloop reviews: 'Ingenious' shooter is a contender for game of the year
description: The action thriller, which takes place in a time loop, delights critics as it debuts on Playstation 5.

title: Afghanistan: Life under Taliban rule one month on
description: Secunder Kermani looks at life in northern Afghanistan, four weeks after the militants seized power.

title: Government reshuffle hires and fires
description: The prime minister has fired a string of cabinet ministers in a major cabinet reshuffle.

title: Cabinet reshuffle 2021: Who is in Boris Johnson's new cabinet?
description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson reshuffles his cabinet for the first time since February 2020. Who's in it now?

title: Nadine Dorries becomes new culture secretary
description: The MP for Mid Bedfordshire and former health minister replaces Oliver Dowden.

title: Claims about Universal Credit fact-checked
description: The government and Labour traded claims about the decision to remove the £20 extra Universal Credit payment.

title: Covid: The lives upended by Australia's sealed border
description: Eighteen months after Australia shut its border, people reveal tales of separation and despair.

title: Emma Raducanu 'hungry' to improve after US Open win - but not sure on Indian Wells
description: Britain's Emma Raducanu says she is "hungry" to improve after her US Open win but wants a few days' rest first.

title: M25 protests: Activists return to Hertfordshire, Surrey and Kent
description: Police arrest 71 people as activists disrupt motorway traffic in Hertfordshire, Surrey and Kent.

title: Boris Johnson to reshuffle top team, says Downing Street
description: The prime minister is set to shake-up his ministerial team over the coming hours, says Downing Street.

title: Warwickshire beat Yorkshire to stay in County Championship title hunt
description: Warwickshire beat Yorkshire to keep their County Championship title ambitions alive and end their opponents' hopes.

title: Universal credit cut will push workers into poverty, warns Tory former minister
description: Former cabinet minister Stephen Crabb joins calls for next month's universal credit cut to be axed.

title: Barrymore pool death: Stuart Lubbock's father Terry dies
description: Terry Lubbock, whose son Stuart died after a party at the entertainer's house, had terminal cancer.

title: NFL This Week: Jason Bell and Osi Umenyiora discuss Patrick Mahomes and Baker Mayfield
description: NFL This Week's Jason Bell and Osi Umenyiora discuss the differences between quarterbacks Patrick Mahomes and Baker Mayfield after Mahomes guided the Kansas City Chiefs to victory over Mayfield's Cleveland Browns.

title: Stenson named Europe's fifth Ryder Cup vice-captain
description: Henrik Stenson is named Europe's fifth and final vice-captain for the Ryder Cup against the United States at Whistling Straits.

title: 'I don't select myself' - veteran Wales captain Jones keen to keep on playing
description: After releasing his autobiography, Wales captain Alun Wyn Jones says he is not quite ready to finish the final chapter of his illustrious playing career.

title: How Nicki Minaj and swollen testicles became part of a UK coronavirus briefing
description: The rapper's comments about vaccines side effects were discussed at a UK coronavirus briefing.

title: Countryside Properties scraps leasehold ground rent rises
description: Developer latest to drop clause campaigners say makes homes impossible to remortgage or sell.

title: North Korea fires two ballistic missiles into East Sea, South says
description: It comes days after North Korea tested a long-range cruise missile capable of hitting much of Japan.

title: Covid: Plan B would be triggered by NHS pressure, Sajid Javid says
description: Government scientists are warning of a jump in Covid hospital admissions if rules are not tightened soon.

title: John Lewis to create thousands of Christmas jobs
description: The partnership is looking to fill 7,000 temporary roles in shops, department stores and warehouses.

title: Leeds fail with Struijk appeal over red card against Liverpool
description: Pascal Struijk will serve a three-match ban after Leeds United lose their appeal against his red card for a tackle on Harvey Elliott in the defeat to Liverpool.

title: Inflation: Price rises see record jump as food costs soar in August
description: The UK inflation rate hit 3.2% in the year to August, according to the latest official figures.

title: Cannabis ban in athletics to be reviewed
description: The World Anti-Doping Agency is to review whether cannabis should remain a banned substance after Sha'Carri Richardson missed the Olympics for testing positive for the substance.

title: Afghanistan: Taliban leaders in bust-up at presidential palace, sources say
description: Taliban officials said factions clashed over how power is divided up in new government.

title: Gleision: 'Guilt of surviving mine disaster with me forever'
description: A decade on from the Gleision mine disaster, two men who survived still carry the weight of the tragedy.

title: The Papers: PM's 'plan for the worst' and 'back to panic stations'
description: Boris Johnson's strategy for tackling Covid during autumn and winter dominate Wednesday's front pages.
